intro: Guayania davidsei, commonly known as the David's guayacan, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, broad leaves, and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
